title: Am I The Only One Actually Hyped For The Preseason?
body:
Sure, some things are going to change for the worse, everyone says how they don't like the plants, I still don't know whether or not I like the Fervor of Battle and armor pen changes and the game that we were just getting used to is going to get turned on its head again.

But that is the beauty of it. There are so much new things to test, with so much things changing and the lack of a pro scene the Meta won't be defined for several months and for that time we can mostly do whatever the fuck we want.

For me as someone who loves this game mainly for theorycrafting and testing new builds, jungle routes etc. in-game, the preseason is basically heaven. There are so much new things to try and if they actually work, you feel much smarter than you actually are.

To everyone who is reading this, just try to have fun for once while playing with the new changes. If you go into the game with the attitude that everything new sucks without even testing it, of course you're not going to have fun with the preseason.

The thing with Stormraiders is that it might help you early and mid game but it falls of a cliff late when you're getting kited more, need to stick to a target and most of them having some MR by then.

It's not as reliable as let's say the free 300 HP mid game that boost your shield, allow you to get Swiftness in the resolve tree and other beneficial stats.

It's not just items, but also masteries. I'm probably wrong, but I feel that champions like Mundo and Volibear lead to some nerfs towards health regeneration masteries. 

Honestly I'm probably just a bit biased, but I worry whenever a new top or jungle tank thing comes because I fear juggernauts will lead to it being nerfed for tanks. Juggernauts can make up for it because they aren't just about being durable, but also about dealing damage. Tanks however really rely on being as durable as possible so they can survive to provide their CC or utility. 

It's just my uneducated concern.

The thing with tank items is that they're as efficient regardless what class you are.
An Assassin can build a randuins and get all the benefits.

Not a single tank item is specifically tailored to them as a class.
And Juggernaut items got abused by other classes because of that as well.

I feel like damage in the game is way too high already, especially with ADCs, and they're only making it _higher_ for them.

They're reducing assassin instant burst potential, so ADCs will just kill them when they try to do anything.

Sadly I can't say I'm very hyped for this.

As someone who likes high burst assassins and mages, I actually want _fewer_ high damage options in masteries because that would allow my picks to shine, rather than just doing the same thing that everyone else does anyways.

How do you outplay an ADC, though?  They'll just right click on you and you die.

The window for assassins to kill has been increased, but not ADCs.  They'll still two-shot you.
You have mobility, they don't. If an adc kills you, you must be bad.
The best counter to mobility is point-and-click, which is what autoattacks are.

ADC counters is that they insta die to any burst and that assassins have that plenty + mobility + evasive tools.
Every assassin worth his salt will win against an ADC

Yeah, that's definitely true.  But they're actually changing that in the preseason - on the assassin side, anyways.

A lot of assassins are getting enforced delays in their kit, like Leblanc, who must wait 1.5 seconds to proc sigil of malice instead of just instant burst.  That's what I'm trying to get at.

A lot of assassins are losing that instant burst.  (Except Khazix, I guess?  I hear he's really strong still)

The only one who got a real deley is like you said - le blac.
The rest just have more room to avoid the fight rather than deleying your death (like rengar or kat)

Well, Rengar got the attack resets on his Q removed.  That's actually pretty huge especially if you've built an IE.

Also he only gets the guaranteed crit on the champion he senses with his thing, which is whoever is closest to him - so allies can potentially bodyblock his crit ability for you?

We'll see soon if he's still insanely bursty with time.

Also, Katarina recieved built in delays too - no more instant Ws while Shunpo'ing; it seems a lot of her damage will come from dropped daggers which take a second to hit the ground after being thrown.  She does still have the ulti, though... As a Katarina main, I'm both excited and afraid to see what it's going to be like.

My main and secondary main are both getting small scale reworks (Kha'Zix, Shaco). My main role is getting a revamp (jungle).

Even if I'm not hype, I have to look forward to it because it effects me so much.

Kha's new evolved Ult and Q seem super fun to me, I'm definitely going to try him. 

On Shaco I actually did a lot of theorycrafting. There are so much new things to consider.

First, there's a really cool new cheese route for Shaco. If you clear Krugs and Red after, you will be level 3 and able invade the enemy blue side jungle before he hits level 3 and cheese kill him at his wolves, if he goes for a full clear. Or you can cheese gank mid when both midlaners are level 2 while you are 3. Most junglers need a long time to clear krugs but Shaco got his boxes which makes it much easier for him.

There's also a new peenetration/CDR build I want to test. Since you already get artificial crits from your new backstab passive and because you don't scale as much with attack speed anymore, going for this build seems much more worth it to me.

It's CDR Boots, Skirmisher's - Warrior, Youmuu's, Duskblade, Ravenous Hydra and a defensive item like Edge of Night, GA or Dead Man's to top it off.

The combination of his Q on-hit + Duskblade on-hit + backstab crit + Hydra + E will make for some hilarious oneshots on squishies.

Then there's the AP build. While I don't know if it's able to jungle properly but it's probably going to be hilarious in the top-and midlane. His Q now has an AP ratio and the duration of boxes now also scales with AP - on top of the clone now also dropping a triangle of boxes, who have an AP scaling on their own. If the new control wards wouldn't be a thing, I feel like this new AP Shaco would be extremely strong.
